text.name: sys_description
text.text: Released in 1978, the Odyssey² is Philips' second-generation console, distributed in the United States by Magnavox and named Videopac G7000 elsewhere in the world. Created to compete with the Atari 2600, it technically paints by using a 1.7 Mhz microcontroller rather than an authentic microprocessor. It has 256 bytes of RAM, a 128 x 64 x 16 color display and a 1 channel 8 voices sound. In 1983 comes the Videopac +, but not the Odyssey² +, an improved version capable of displaying backgrounds sets. It will be much less successful than the Atari 2600 and other Mattel Intellivision.
